availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Leroy S. Mitchell (Union County constable. AKA L.S. Mitchell)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, constable. Kentucky native. Married Sarah E. Mitchell. Father of Douglass Mitchell, Osker Mitchell, Christian Mitchell, and Alice Mitchell. Constable in Union County in 1861.

ab.bibl: "An act for the benefit of Leroy S. Mitchell, late constable of Union County," September 7, 1861, in Journal of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, (Frankfort, KY: The Yeoman Office, 1861), 60. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Caseyville, Shilo Precinct, p. 18.
